BloodTest.Title: Blood test
BloodTest.Dialogue: There is nothing conclusive but indicates that scans might lead to something.

Antibiotics.Title: Antibiotics
Antibiotics.Dialogue: I tried them for a few months, but there were no improvements in my condition.

Neurologist.Title: Neurologist
Neurologist.Dialogue: "Sorry, I couldn’t pinpoint the issue. You should give a rheumatologist or a genetic testing a try."

GeneticTesting.Title: Genetic testing
GeneticTesting.Dialogue: The test showed that my genetics are susceptible to cancer, I might learn more with an oncologist.

Oncologist.Title: Oncologist
Oncologist.Dialogue: “I don’t know what you have. There is no sign of cancer. I’m sorry I can’t help you more.”

Rheumatologist.Title: Rheumatologist
Rheumatologist.Dialogue: “This is out of my specialty. I can refer you to a trial treatment. Also, I suggest an endoscopy.”

TrialTreatment.Title: Trial treatment
TrialTreatment.Dialogue: I tried the treatment for a year, but it didn't help my condition whatsoever.

Endoscopy.Title: Endoscopy
Endoscopy.Dialogue: It shows that my lungs might have an issue, so I could check a pulmonologist.

Pulmonologist.Title: Pulmonologist
Pulmonologist.Dialogue: “Your lungs aren’t functioning properly. I believe you have a condition where each lung acts independently from the other during sleep. This would explain the symptoms that you have. We found the crux of the issue.”
